articles.author: Chicago Tribune
articles.title: Mattel plans to raise prices on some toys to offset tariff costs
articles.description: Mattel Inc., the maker of Barbie dolls, Hot Wheels cars and other popular toys, said Monday that it would have to raise prices for some products sold in the U.S. “where necessary” to offset higher costs related to President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

articles.title: New York Times wins 4 Pulitzers, New Yorker 3; Washington Post wins for coverage of Trump shooting
articles.description: The New York Times won four Pulitzer Prizes and the New Yorker three on Monday for journalism in 2024 that touched on topics like the fentanyl crisis, the U.S. military and last summer’s assassination attempt on President Donald Trump. The Pulitzers’ prestigious public service medal went to ProPublica […]

articles.title: Trump's Tariff on Foreign-Made Films Faces Legal Hurdles
articles.description: President Trump's plan to impose 100% tariffs on foreign-made films faces a number of legal and practical obstacles.
articles.content:
President Trump is on shaky legal ground if he follows through on a plan to impose a 100% tariff on films produced “in foreign lands.” Experts agree that the pledge is legally dubious and also faces logistical hurdles.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Court Blocks Trump's Move to Revoke Migrant Parole
articles.description: A federal appeals court denied the Trump administration's attempt to revoke temporary legal status for many migrants. The Boston-based court upheld a ruling against the Department of Homeland Security's plan to end a Biden-era parole program, arguing the administration could not prove the legality of this action on appeal.
